title: Alternator Regulator/Rectifier - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
The alternator regulator/rectifier is attached to the cradle assembly at the rear of the radiator. The regulator/rectifier does not contain any serviceable parts and must be replaced if faulty.
Seat and Battery - Remove - DB4; DBB; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU4; DUB; DUC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DTC; DB4; DT4; DU4

body.body: If the motorcycle has recently been running, some components may be hot to the touch.
Contact with the hot components may cause damage to exposed skin.
To avoid skin damage, always allow the hot parts to cool before working on the motorcycle.
Note the position of the electrical connectors for installation.
Release and discard the two fixings securing the regulator/rectifier bracket to the cradles.
Disconnect both electrical connectors and remove the regulator/rectifier and it's bracket.
Release the fixings and remove the regulator/rectifier from it's bracket.

metadata.products: DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DTC; DPZ; DCZ; DU4; DT4; DB4; D64; D54; DP4; DC4; DC3; DP3
